info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rock Island, northeastern Mercer, southwestern Whiteside, western Henry and east central Scott Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 145 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Geneseo to near Lynn Center. Movement was northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Geneseo around 150 PM CDT. Orion and Osborn around 200 PM CDT. Sherrard and Cleveland around 205 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Warner, Moline, Silvis, Milan, Colona, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Port Byron, Rapids City and Oak Grove. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa near mile marker 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 24. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 4 and 30. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 280 between mile markers 17 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
